revised_title: An Investigation of Outlying Nerve-cells in the Mammalian Spinal Cord
tldr: The author examines the existence and location of outlying nerve-cells in the mammalian spinal cord, specifically in the anterior, lateral, and posterior white columns. They discuss the possible connections between these isolated cells and the surrounding nerve fibers, as well as the implications for understanding neural pathways and communication within the spinal cord.
